main event: On 25 August 1952, John L. Spitsbergen and three others observed a cigar-shaped unidentified flying object with a white light and a red flashing light in Palmyra, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The object was described as cigar-shaped and was estimated to be about 1,500 feet in the air., The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes., The weather conditions at the time were clear with 15 miles visibility., The investigator concluded the object was most likely a weather balloon but could not definitively identify it., Four total witnesses reported seeing the object.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object with a white light and a red flashing light
witness description: John L. Spitsbergen and three other witnesses
